title: Introduced `chunk` API

I could not make [the new test case](https://github.com/nearprotocol/nearcore/pull/1524/files#diff-9038756cf0318ed127567e2c3abe5490), which requests a chunk by block height (0) and shard id (0), working:

```
Chunk Missing: ChunkHash(`CiADPKxqY5XoSAQAkLjKohFWj9cK3tBrUVKqaEkCpU4v`)
```

Other than that, the implementation is working fine.

REMINDER: Update [the docs](https://docs.nearprotocol.com/api-documentation/rpc) with the information about the new API.

title: Move rewards to runtime
body:
- Move validator account update to Runtime from NightshadeRuntime.
- Update `.apply` API to avoid `clone` issue.
- Move check_balance to its own crate.
- Add test for the `clone` issue.
- Remove clone clutch.
- Fix double rewards for a treasury account staking.

Fixes #1481

title: Use information returned from runtime for reward calculation
body: Fixes the issue that gas price may change between blocks if a transaction generates receipts that are not executed in the same block.

title: minimum sized docker image
body:
Our docker image is have unnecessary part that result in big size. Everything except the result binary and a run.sh is not necessary. This pr reduce the image size to phusion base image + binary by copying built binary into an empty image. The reason of doing this rather than deleting files in original image is once data is in a layer or image you cannot remove it. For example, try add ` RUN rm -rf /usr/local/rustup`, which is >2gb, in original dockerfile, `make` again, and check image size by `docker image ls`, image size doesn't changed.

After this change docker build steps: still `make`, tag, push

body: Fixes #1490.

title: Merge master into staging
body:
Sorry I shouldn't click "squash and merge", which result in code went to repo but commit wasn't. Recreate PR to merge. I'll rebase all "resolving conflict" and "change on reviews" commits into one commit

update: cannot rebase, every commit gives a conflict, which content is resolving all conflicts between master and staging from begining. can we have this unrebased?

title: Few changes after transaction routing
body:
- Chainging the python sanity test to use routing (it passes)
- Changing how the horizon is working
  Before this change it was checking heights (H, H+1, H+2), and
  then routing to H+2. It is both wrong to check H (the chunk at
  H is already produced), and wrong to send to the last height we
  checked, because the recepient with a high chance one block
  behind us, and will redundantly re-forward the transaction.
  Now it looks at (H+1, H+2, H+3), still forwards to H+2.
- The previous change also fixes most of the catchup tests, since
  two blocks horizon was not enough under stress. Shifting horizon
  one block forward fixed most of them.

Some catchup tests still fail due to #1484

title: Clutch for #1481
body: Temporary fix the initial state cloning using actual cloning.

title: Add new round on handshake if invalid nonce.
body: Fix the problem for dropping connection if nonce is invalid, which happens after loosing data on shutdown.

title: Remove `@` separator from accounts.
body:
`@` separator is not popular enough and hurts UX in the wallet. We can't prefix every account_id with `@` in the wallet if the `@` is allowed within an account ID.

Discussed with @vgrichina, @jakestutzman and @kcole16 and we've decided to remove this separator completely.

title: get_header_on_chain method
body: The method allows to get a header on the selected chain, not only canonical. The chain is defined by the hash of the header of the block on that chain.

title: Transaction propagation fixed. Added test that showcases it. Test als…
body:
Previously Tx propagation didn't work for two reasons:
 - RPC calling to Client wasn't actually handling response for forwarding tx
 - If node wasn't tracking shard that this tx is originating - it would just return invalid tx.

Fixed both issues with test that showcases it.
 + Setup this test to also check RPC forwarding by having a light client that must be queriable (but not right now)

title: native test runner to replace docker runner and clean up
body:
This runs test on shell (outside of docker) on ci, which should be exactly same when you `cargo test` locally. It should be faster and less flaky. Currently I only launch one node (buidl-7) once this is merged I can adjust buidl-1~6 to be shell runners.

Also: clean outdated cache is going to be a cron job in runner instance, moving away from gitlab-ci.yml to avoid different branch diverge in the frequency of cleaning cache.

title: Add a check into Runtime to compare input and output balances
body:
Compares the total balance sum at the beginning of `.apply` including incomings receipts and the total balance after `.apply` 
* Remove dead code  -`verifier` crate
* Fix some fees:
  - Data receipts - are completely prepaid. Bot send and exec fees are considered `burnt`, which means are paid at creation.
  - Send fees - are also `burnt` gas and should be paid during creation.
* Introduce `ApplyStats`
  - `total_verifier_rewards` has to be computed by Runtime, cause Gas might have different cost across receipts, so we can't rely on the header gas price.
  - `total_balance_burnt`, if the refund arrives on the non-existing account (e.g. when account receiving the reward was deleted before the refund arrived), the balance is considered burnt. Chain should potentially distribute this balance as reward, or account it as burnt and decrease total supply.

title: Subtree sizes in trie
body: Add subtree sizes to trie nodes. The size is also used in computing hashes, so all hashes will change.

body: I forgot that for certain params estimator will not work because it will try re-creating accounts with the same name.

title: Prometheus
body:
# Metrics

The PR is designed to add metrics to NEAR. Metrics are done in two stages; Prometheus and Grafana. 

## Prometheus

To setup Prometheus a HTTP endpoint is require it was added as `GET /metrics` running under the configured HTTP port.

Each individual metric was added to a `metrics.rs` file in the crate where it was used. These must be initialised only once and hence are wrapped in the `lazy_static` macro.

Within the code the metrics are modified through the `near-metrics` create which is a wrapper class to handle the cases where initialisation of a metric fails.

Starting Prometheus with the config in `nearcore/conf/prometheus-near.yml` will tell Prometheus to hit the `GET /metrics` API which will gather all the metrics within NEAR and send them to Prometheus.

Raw Prometheus can then be viewed on `localhost:9090`

## Grafana

Grafana needs to be setup as specified in the `METRICS.md` and will talk to Prometheus. Grafana then uses queries to make the data easier to read and interpret, in the form of graphs and figures.

## Going Forward

Currently the impact of running these metrics has not been measured. I would consider wrapping them in a rust feature maybe that can be turned on or off.

Some features will output 'no data points' or 'N/A' which means that the data is not being pulled from Prometheus. This is due to `lazy_static` which will only initialise an object when it is first called. Hence if a metric is never used it will not be initialised it will not have data points.

It should be relatively easy to add additional metrics by adding it to/creating a `metrics.rs` then adjusting it as required.

Edit:
p.s. Tried not to make any merge conflicts by only `cargo fmt` the files I touched but it did change a couple of other things.

title: Chunk request retry
body:
When we request one part or chunk parts - record the information about request and periodically check if we haven't received it yet - retry again.

Adds two constants: how long before retries and how long total to wait.
Currently there is no number limit on the number of active requests (e.g. waits only until they expire), which might be useful to fix if the expiration time is too long.

---

The PR is overtaken by @SkidanovAlex , few other things changed:
- Fixed an issue that validators never tried to re-fetch missing one parts if a validator had more than one part assigned and didn't care about the shard, which was causing system stalling.
- Removed orphaned_one_parts, as it was a hack to get around not re-requesting one parts.
- Removed most of the unnecessary disk reads in the test infra, since deserializing BLS signatures after fetching stuff from disk is extremely expensive
- Changed test infra to always have `total_parts` to be at least `data_parts * 2 + 1`, since otherwise it is not guaranteed that a chain without available data will not win
- Increased the epoch length in the hardcore tests from 5 to 20, to allow stress tests work under lower block timeouts.
- Fixing many other small issues discovered by the new test that drops messages.

title: Proper check for transaction history validation
body: Fixes #1386 by maintaining a cache of the block headers in the current fork.
